author: Madurai Bureau
text:
Arrangements are in place in the district for the smooth conduct of Plus Two examinations which are scheduled to commence on Friday.

As many as 20,105 regular students and 956 private candidates are expected to write the exams in the district. Exam halls had been arranged in various schools in 65 centres, reliable sources from Education Department said here on Thursday.

Officials deputed to monitor the proceedings in the exam halls were asked to take stringent measures against any kind of malpractice. Students should enter the exam halls at 9.45 a.m.

They should be in possession of hall tickets and other necessary materials meant for the examinations.

Students should not carry mobile phones to the exam halls, sources added.

Nagercoil

As many as 26,511 students including 13,396 girls would appear for the Plus Two examination in Kanyakumari district beginning Friday.

Apart from these 55 differently abled persons and private candidates are also appearing for the examination.

Twenty scribes have been appointed to assist blind students and those students affected by dyslexia, sources in the education department said.

26,511 students to appear for the examinations in Kanyakumari district
title: 20,105 students to take Plus Two exams in Thoothukudi
